control
Class Player

java.lang.Object
  control.Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
AIPlayer, StupidPlayer
public abstract class Player
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a player in a Cluedo game. Note that this is a abstract class, meaning that you have to implement the player's behavior by your own (i.e. AI or using a user interface). Furthermore, it can be seen as colleague (GoF Mediator) with Game as mediator.

See Also:
Game, Game.getPlayers(), AIPlayer, StupidPlayer

beginGame

public void beginGame(java.util.Set<Card> handCards)
               throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Set the hand cards of this player. This should be only done at the beginning of the game.

Parameters:
handCards - list of hand cards
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException

play

public abstract Suggestion play()
This method indicates that the players turn has begun. Therefore, the player has to announce a suggestion when this method is called. The player receives the answer from the game logic via receiveAnswer

Returns:
the suggestion the player announces
See Also:
receiveAnswer(Suggestion, Card, Player, Set)

receiveSuggestion

public abstract Card receiveSuggestion(Player questionair,
                                       Suggestion suggestion)
                                throws java.lang.NullPointerException
When this method is called, the player is ask to disprove a suggestion. Returns null if the player is not able to disprove it, a hand card otherwise.

Parameters:
questionair - player who announced the suggestion
suggestion - Suggestion to disprove
Returns:
null if cannot disprove or a disproving Card
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if an argument is null

receiveAnswer

public abstract void receiveAnswer(Suggestion suggestion,
                                   Card card,
                                   Player answerer,
                                   java.util.Set<Player> couldNotAnswer)
                            throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Call this method to notify the player about the outcome of his/her last announced suggestion.

Parameters:
suggestion - subjected suggestion
card - card which was shown by answerer
answerer - player which answered
couldNotAnswer - set of players which could not answer
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if suggestion is null
See Also:
observeMove(Suggestion, Player, Player, Set)

observeMove

public abstract void observeMove(Suggestion suggestion,
                                 Player questionair,
                                 Player answerer,
                                 java.util.Set<Player> couldNotAnswer)
                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
This method is called when a player show another player a card hidden from this player.

Parameters:
suggestion - subjected suggestion
questionair - asking player
answerer - answering player
couldNotAnswer - set of players which could not answer
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if suggestion or couldNotAnswer are null
